  • uDMA

uDMA¶

The DMA controller is an optional high performance, low area/energy consumption DMA engine for use in the ARC EM 2.0 cores.

The DMA controller supports the following features:

  • 1 to 16 independent programmable DMA channels (number of channels is configurable)

  • User-programmable prioritization scheme for all available channels

  • Concurrent operation with the CPU

  • Software/Hardware–triggered DMA transfers

  • Two addressing modes

  • Five data transfer modes (configurable down to one)

  • Internal and external interrupt support

API Reference¶

group ARC_HAL_MISC_UDMA

DMACHANNEL(x)¶

Channel number to Bit

DMA_IDLE¶

DMA working status enumeration Current DMA status is IDLE

DMA_BUSY¶

Current DMA status is busy, in transfer

DMA_ERROR¶

Current DMA status is error, in transfer error

DMA_STOP¶

Current DMA is stop by user

DMA_CHN_ANY¶

Any channel, request one

DMA_CHN_INVALID¶

Invalid channel

DMA_REQ_SOFT¶

DMA channel request or trigger source enumeration Software trigger

DMA_REQ_PERIPHERAL¶

Peripheral trigger

DMA_INVALID_TRANSFER¶

DMA channel control bit field enumeration - DMA Operation (OP) Invalid channel

DMA_SINGLE_TRANSFER¶

Single Block

DMA_AUTO_LINKED_TRANSFER¶

Link-List (Auto-Request)

DMA_MANUAL_LINKED_TRANSFER¶

Link-List (Manual-Request)

DMA_AUTO_REQUEST¶

DMA channel control bit field enumeration - Request Type (RT) Auto-request following channel arbitration

DMA_MANUAL_REQUEST¶

Manual-request following channel arbitration

DMA_MEM2MEM¶

DMA channel control bit field enumeration - Data Transfer Type (DTT) Memory to Memory

DMA_MEM2AUX¶

Memory to Auxiliary

DMA_AUX2MEM¶

Auxiliary to Memory

DMA_AUX2AUX¶

Auxiliary to Auxiliary

DMA_DW1INC1¶

DMA channel control bit field enumeration - Data Width/Increment (DW/INC) dw=byte, inc=byte

DMA_DW1INC2¶

dw=byte, inc=half-word

DMA_DW1INC4¶

dw=byte, inc=word

DMA_DW2INC2¶

dw=half-word, inc=half-word

DMA_DW2INC4¶

dw=half-word, inc=word

DMA_DW4INC4¶

dw=word, inc=word

DMA_DWINC_CLR¶

clear mode (dw=word, inc=word)

DMA_DW8INC8¶

dw=double-word, inc=double-word(Only supported in HS)

DMA_INT_DISABLE¶

DMA channel control bit field enumeration - Internal/External Interrupt enable (INT) Interrupt disabled, no interrupt raised is on completion of a data transfer

DMA_INT_ENABLE¶

Interrupt enabled, a level interrupt raised on completion of a data transfer

DMA_AM_SRCNOT_DSTNOT¶

DMA channel control bit field enumeration - Address update Mode (AM) No Source or Destination Address increment

DMA_AM_SRCINC_DSTNOT¶

Source Address incremented, Destination Address not incremented

DMA_AM_SRCNOT_DSTINC¶

Source Address not incremented, Destination Address incremented

DMA_AM_SRCINC_DSTINC¶

Source Address and Destination Address incremented

DMA_CHN_NORM_PRIO¶

DMA channel priority enumeration Normal priority

DMA_CHN_HIGH_PRIO¶

High priority

DMA_MEMORY_CHANNEL_NUM¶

Number of Memory based DMA Channel

DMA_CHECK_REGISTER(channel)¶

Check whether channel have register interface

  • val: Target value

Typedefs

typedef void (*DMA_CALLBACK_T)(void *param)¶

Handler function for uDAM callback, param should be current dma channel transfer structure DMA_CHANNEL_T

Functions

static void dmac_interrupt_completed(void *ptr)¶

Interrupt about DMA transaction completion ! Sets the the “complete” status for completed DMA transaction and ! starts next transaction from queue. Reset DMA completion IRQ flags

static void dmac_interrupt_completed_channel(uint32_t channel)¶
static void dmac_interrupt_error(void *ptr)¶

Interrupt about DMA transaction completion with error ! Sets the the “complete with error” status for completed DMA transaction ! Reset the DMA channel.

static void dmac_fill_descriptor(uint32_t channel, DMA_DESC_T *desc)¶
int32_t dmac_init(DMA_STATE_T *state)¶

Initialize uDMA controller with a valid DMA_STATE_T structure.

If you want to use this uDMA driver, you need to call the dmac_init function with a valid state, dmac will init the valid state. If initialized successfully, you can use the other uDMA APIs.

Parameters

  • state: DMA state structure to maintain uDMA resources, this should not be NULL

Return Value

  • -1: State is NULL

  • 0: Initialize successfully

static void dmac_process_desc(DMA_DESC_T *desc, uint32_t ienable)¶
static int32_t dmac_valid_channel(int32_t channel, DMA_DESC_T *desc)¶
static void dma_claim_channel(int32_t channel, DMA_CHANNEL_T *dma_chn, uint32_t source)¶
void dmac_close(void)¶

Close uDMA controller.

This function disable all DMA channels.

int32_t dmac_config_desc(DMA_DESC_T *desc, void *src, void *dst, uint32_t size, DMA_CTRL_T *ctrl)¶

Configure uDMA descriptor with source/destination address, transfer size in bytes and ctrl mode.

Note

The DMALLPx of desc will be set to NULL in this function, and DMACTRLx of desc will be set with right transfer size

Parameters

  • desc: uDMA descriptor, this should not be NULL

  • src: Source address for the uDMA transfer

  • dst: Destination address for the uDMA transfer

  • size: Actual transfer size in bytes

  • ctrl: uDMA channel control value

Return Value

  • -1: desc is NULL

  • 0: OK

int32_t dmac_desc_add_linked(DMA_DESC_T *head, DMA_DESC_T *next)¶

Set uDMA channel linked-list pointer register, head -> next.

Parameters

  • head: uDMA descriptor, should not be NULL

  • next: uDMA descriptor, could be NULL

Return Value

  • -1: head is NULL

  • 0: OK

int32_t dmac_init_channel(DMA_CHANNEL_T *dma_chn)¶

Initialize a channel for DMA transfer.

Note

Channel will be set to DMA_CHN_INVALID

Parameters

  • dma_chn: Data structure containing the default configuration for the selected channel, should not be NULL

Return Value

  • -1: dma_chn is NULL

  • 0: OK

int32_t dmac_config_channel(DMA_CHANNEL_T *dma_chn, DMA_DESC_T *desc)¶

Configure channel for DMA transfer.

Parameters

  • dma_chn: Data structure containing the intended configuration for the selected channel, should not be NULL

  • desc: uDMA descriptor

Return Value

  • -1: dma_chn is NULL

  • 0: OK

int32_t dmac_reserve_channel(int32_t channel, DMA_CHANNEL_T *dma_chn, uint32_t source)¶

Reserve a DMA channel, bind it with dma_chn, and set the dma trigger source.

Parameters

  • channel: This can be DMA_CHN_ANY or any valid channel id. For DMA_CHN_ANY, it will try to peek an available channel. For any valid channel id, it will try to reserve that channel.

  • dma_chn: uDMA channel structure, should not be NULL

  • source: DMA trigger source, this can be any value in uint32_t enum

Return Value

  • DMA_CHN_INVALID: dma_chn is NULL, or channel is not a valid one, or there is no channel available now

  • 0-DMA_ALL_CHANNEL_NUM: The channel id that reserved

int32_t dmac_start_channel(DMA_CHANNEL_T *dma_chn, DMA_CALLBACK_T callback, uint32_t priority)¶

Start uDMA transfer for dma_chn, set handler function for uDAM callback and transfer priority.

Note

When callback is NULL, then all INT field in DMA descriptor will be set to interrupt disable, otherwise it will be set to interrupt enable

Parameters

  • dma_chn: uDMA channel structure, should not be NULL

  • callback: Handler function, when DMA transfer is done, it will be called with parameter which value is dma_chn

  • priority: uDMA transfer priority

Return Value

  • -1: dma_chn is NULL or dma_chn->desc is NULL or channel of dma_chn is not a valid one or dma_chn is still in transfer

  • -2: When channel is a aux-based channel, the dma descriptor should not be a linked list

  • 0: OK

int32_t dmac_stop_channel(DMA_CHANNEL_T *dma_chn)¶

Stop uDMA transfer.

Parameters

  • dma_chn: uDMA channel structure, should not be NULL

Return Value

  • -1: dma_chn is NULL or dma_chn->desc is NULL or channel of dma_chn is not a valid one

  • 0: OK

int32_t dmac_clear_channel(DMA_CHANNEL_T *dma_chn)¶

Clear channel transfer status and set it to DMA_IDLE.

Parameters

  • dma_chn: uDMA channel structure, should not be NULL

Return Value

  • -1: dma_chn is NULL or dma_chn->desc is NULL or channel of dma_chn is not a valid one

  • 0: OK

int32_t dmac_release_channel(DMA_CHANNEL_T *dma_chn)¶

Release an uDMA channel.

Parameters

  • dma_chn: Channel tansfer structure of uDMA channel to be released, should not be NULL

Return Value

  • -1: dma_chn is NULL or dma_chn->desc is NULL or channel of dma_chn is not a valid one

  • 0: OK

int32_t dmac_wait_channel(DMA_CHANNEL_T *dma_chn)¶

Wait until uDMA channel job is completed.

Parameters

  • dma_chn: Channel tansfer structure of uDMA channel, should not be NULL

Return Value

  • -1: dma_chn is NULL or dma_chn->desc is NULL or channel of dma_chn is not a valid one

  • DMA_IDLE: Transfer is done without error

  • DMA_ERROR: Transfer is done with error

int32_t dmac_check_channel(DMA_CHANNEL_T *dma_chn)¶

Check channel transfer status.

Parameters

  • dma_chn: Channel tansfer structure of uDMA channel, should not be NULL

Return Value

  • -1: dma_chn is NULL or dma_chn->desc is NULL or channel of dma_chn is not a valid one

  • DMA_BUSY: Still in transfer state

  • DMA_IDLE: Transfer is done without error

  • DMA_ERROR: Transfer is done with error
